statements.name: PROC SEQTEST
statements.description: The purpose of the SEQTEST procedure is to perform interim analyses for clinical trials. Clinical trials are experiments on human beings to demonstrate the efficacy and safety of new drugs or treatments. A simple example is a trial to test the effectiveness of a new drug in humans by comparing the outcomes in a group of patients who receive the new drug with the outcomes in a comparable group of patients who receive a placebo. † A clinical trial is conducted according to a plan called a protocol. A protocol details the objectives of the trial, the data collection process, and the analyses of the data. The protocol contains information such as a null hypothesis and an alternative hypothesis, a test statistic, the probability α of a Type I error (incorrectly rejecting the null hypothesis), the probability β of a Type II error (incorrectly accepting the null hypothesis), the sample size needed to attain a specified power (probability of correctly rejecting the null hypothesis) of 1-β at an alternative reference, and critical values that are associated with the test statistic for hypothesis testing.
statements.help: PROC SEQTEST <BETABOUNDARY=BINDING | NONBINDING> <BETAOVERLAP=ADJUST | NOADJUST> <BOUNDARY=SAS-data-set> <BOUNDARYADJ(ALPHA)=NONE | ERRLINE | ERRFUNCGAMMA... > <BOUNDARYADJ(BETA)=NONE | ERRLINE | ERRFUNCGAMMA... > <BOUNDARYADJ(LOWERALPHA)=NONE | ERRLINE | ERRFUNCGAMMA... > <BOUNDARYADJ(LOWERBETA)=NONE | ERRLINE | ERRFUNCGAMMA... > <BOUNDARYADJ(UPPERALPHA)=NONE | ERRLINE | ERRFUNCGAMMA... > <BOUNDARYADJ(UPPERBETA)=NONE | ERRLINE | ERRFUNCGAMMA... > <BOUNDARYADJ=NONE | ERRLINE | ERRFUNCGAMMA... > <BOUNDARYKEY=ALPHA | BETA | BOTH> <BOUNDARYSCALE=MLE | SCORE | STDZ... > <CIALPHA=<(<LOWER=al> <UPPER=au>)>> <CITYPELOWER | UPPER | TWOSIDED> <CONDPOWER <( CREF=numbers )>> <DATA <(TESTVAR=variable)>=SAS-data-set> <ERRSPEND> <ERRSPENDMIN(ALPHA)=> <ERRSPENDMIN(BETA)=> <ERRSPENDMIN(LOWERALPHA)=> <ERRSPENDMIN(LOWERBETA)=> <ERRSPENDMIN(UPPERALPHA)=> <ERRSPENDMIN(UPPERBETA)=> <ERRSPENDMIN<(boundary)>=numbers> <MAXINFO=number> <NSTAGES=number> <ORDER=LR | MLE | STAGEWISE> <PARMS <(TESTVAR=variable)> =SAS-data-set> <PLOTS=ALL | ASN | CONDPOWER... > <PREDPOWER> <PSS <( CREF=numbers ) >> <RCI> <STOPPROB <( CREF=numbers ) >>;

arguments.name: BETABOUNDARY=
arguments.description: Specifies whether the β boundary is used in the computation of the Type I error level α.

arguments.name: BINDING
arguments.description: Computes the Type I error probability with the β (acceptance) boundary.

arguments.name: NONBINDING
arguments.description: Computes the Type I error probability without the β boundary.

arguments.name: BETAOVERLAP=
arguments.description: Syntax: BETAOVERLAP=ADJUST | NOADJUST OVERLAP=ADJUST | NOADJUST

arguments.name: ADJUST
arguments.description: The type of overlapping might result from a small β spending at an interim stage. When you specify BETAOVERLAP=ADJUST, the procedure checks for this type of overlapping at the current and subsequent interim stages. If such overlapping is found, the β boundaries for the two-sided design at that stage are set to missing, and the β spending values at subsequent stages are adjusted.

arguments.name: NOADJUST
arguments.description: You can specify BETAOVERLAP=NOADJUST to request that no adjustment be made. The default is BETAOVERLAP=ADJUST.

arguments.name: BOUNDARY=
arguments.description: Names the required SAS data set containing the design boundary information.

arguments.name: BOUNDARYADJ(ALPHA)=
arguments.description: Specifies methods for boundary adjustments if an information level at a stage does not have a matched information level in the original design. The default is BOUNDARYADJ=ERRLINE.
arguments.help: BOUNDARYADJ(ALPHA)=NONE | ERRLINE | ERRFUNCGAMMA | ERRFUNCOBF | ERRFUNCPOC | ERRFUNCPOW

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: Specifies that the cumulative error spending at each interim stage not be changed, even if the corresponding information level has been changed.

arguments.name: ERRLINE
arguments.description: Specifies the linear interpolation method for the adjustment.

arguments.name: ERRFUNCGAMMA
arguments.description: [Syntax: ERRFUNCGAMMA<(GAMMA=value)>] Specifies the γ function method for the adjustment.

arguments.name: ERRFUNCOBF
arguments.description: Specifies the approximate O’Brien-Fleming cumulative error spending function for the adjustment.

arguments.name: ERRFUNCPOC
arguments.description: Specifies the approximate Pocock cumulative error spending function for the adjustment.

arguments.name: ERRFUNCPOW
arguments.description: [Syntax: ERRFUNCPOW<(RHO=value)>] Specifies the power function method for the adjustment. The RHO= suboption specifies the power parameter p in the function.

arguments.name: BOUNDARYADJ(BETA)=
arguments.description: Specifies methods for boundary adjustments if an information level at a stage does not have a matched information level in the original design. The default is BOUNDARYADJ=ERRLINE.
arguments.help: BOUNDARYADJ(BETA)=NONE | ERRLINE | ERRFUNCGAMMA | ERRFUNCOBF | ERRFUNCPOC | ERRFUNCPOW

arguments.help: BOUNDARYADJ=NONE | ERRLINE | ERRFUNCGAMMA | ERRFUNCOBF | ERRFUNCPOC | ERRFUNCPOW

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: Specifies that the cumulative error spending at each interim stage not be changed, even if the corresponding information level has been changed.

arguments.name: ERRLINE
arguments.description: Specifies the linear interpolation method for the adjustment.

arguments.name: ERRFUNCGAMMA
arguments.description: Specifies the γ function method for the adjustment.

arguments.name: ERRFUNCOBF
arguments.description: Specifies the approximate O’Brien-Fleming cumulative error spending function for the adjustment.

arguments.description: Specifies the approximate Pocock cumulative error spending function for the adjustment.

arguments.description: [Syntax: ERRFUNCPOW<(RHO=value)>] Specifies the power function method for the adjustment. The RHO= suboption specifies the power parameter p in the function.

arguments.name: BOUNDARYKEY=
arguments.description: Specifies the boundary key to be maintained in the boundary adjustments.

arguments.name: ALPHA
arguments.description: Maintains the Type I error probability level α and derives Type II error probability.

arguments.name: BETA
arguments.description: Maintains the Type II error probability level β and derives Type I error probability.

arguments.name: BOTH
arguments.description: Maintains both α and β levels simultaneously by deriving a new maximum information.

arguments.name: BOUNDARYSCALE=
arguments.description: Specifies the boundary scale to be displayed in the boundaries for the output boundary table and boundary plots.

arguments.name: MLE
arguments.description: Corresponds to the boundary with the maximum likelihood estimator scale.

arguments.name: SCORE
arguments.description: Corresponds to the boundary with the score statistic scale.

arguments.name: STDZ
arguments.description: Corresponds to the boundary with the standardized normal Z scale.

arguments.name: PVALUE
arguments.description: Corresponds to the boundary with the p-value scale.

arguments.name: CIALPHA=
arguments.description: Specifies the significance levels for the confidence interval, where 0 < p < 1,  0 < al < 0.5, and 0 < au < 0.5. The default is CIALPHA= 0.05.

arguments.name: CITYPE
arguments.description: Specifies the type of confidence interval.

arguments.name: LOWER
arguments.description: Lower confidence interval

arguments.name: UPPER
arguments.description: Upper confidence interval

arguments.name: TWOSIDED
arguments.description: Two-sided confidence interval

arguments.name: CONDPOWER
arguments.description: Displays conditional powers given the most recently observed statistic under specified hypothetical references. The default is CREF= 0 0.5 1.0 1.5.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: Names the SAS data set containing the test statistics and information levels.

arguments.name: ERRSPEND
arguments.description: Displays the error spending at each stage for each sequential boundary.

arguments.name: ERRSPENDMIN(ALPHA)=
arguments.description: Specifies the minimum error spending values for the α boundary of a one-sided design or the lower and upper α boundaries of a two-sided design.

arguments.name: ERRSPENDMIN(BETA)=
arguments.description: Specifies the minimum error spending values for the β boundary of a one-sided design or the lower and upper β boundaries of a two-sided design.

arguments.name: ERRSPENDMIN(LOWERALPHA)=
arguments.description: Specifies the minimum error spending values for the lower α boundary of a two-sided design.

arguments.name: ERRSPENDMIN(LOWERBETA)=
arguments.description: Specifies the minimum error spending values for the lower β boundary of a two-sided design.

arguments.name: ERRSPENDMIN(UPPERALPHA)=
arguments.description: Specifies the minimum error spending values for the upper α boundary of a two-sided design.

arguments.name: ERRSPENDMIN(UPPERBETA)=
arguments.description: Specifies the minimum error spending values for the upper β boundary of a two-sided design.

arguments.name: ERRSPENDMIN=
arguments.description: Specifies the minimum error spending values at interim stages for the boundary. The default is ERRSPENDMIN=0. Use this if a set of numbers is used for each boundary in the design. Otherwise, use one of the ERRSPENDMIN(boundary)=numbers options.

arguments.name: MAXINFO=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum information for the clinical trial if the information is not available from the variable _Info_ in the DATA= data set.

arguments.name: NSTAGES=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of stages for the clinical trial.

arguments.name: ORDER=
arguments.description: Specifies the ordering of the sample space (k,z), where k is the stage number and z is the observed standardized Z statistic.

arguments.name: LR
arguments.description: Specifies the LR ordering that compares the distances between observed standardized Z statistics and their corresponding hypothetical values.

arguments.name: MLE
arguments.description: Specifies the MLE ordering that compares values in the MLE scale.

arguments.name: STAGEWISE
arguments.description: Specifies the stage-wise ordering that uses counterclockwise ordering around the continuous region.

arguments.name: PARMS=
arguments.description: Names the SAS data set containing the parameter estimates and their associated standard errors.

arguments.name: PLOTS=
arguments.description: Syntax: PLOTS <( ONLY )> <= plot-request> PLOTS <( ONLY )> <= ( plot-request < ...plot-request> ) > Specifies options that control the details of the plots. The default is PLOTS=BOUNDARY.
arguments.help: PLOTS=ALL | ASN | CONDPOWER | ERRSPEND | NONE | POWER | RCI | TEST

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: Produces all appropriate plots.

arguments.name: ASN
arguments.description: Displays a plot of the average sample numbers (expected sample sizes), under various hypothetical references. For a one-sided design, the power and expected sample sizes under hypotheses θ=ci*thetha1 are displayed, where θ1 is the alternative reference and ci are the values specified in the CREF= option. For a two-sided design, the power and expected sample sizes under hypotheses θ=ci*thetha1l and θ=ci*thetha1u are displayed, where thetha1l and thetha1u are the lower and upper alternative references, respectively. The default is CREF=0 to 1.5 by 0.01.

arguments.name: CONDPOWER
arguments.description: Displays a plot of conditional powers given the most recently observed statistic under specified hypothetical references. For a one-sided design, the power and expected sample sizes under hypotheses θ=ci*thetha1 are displayed, where θ1 is the alternative reference and ci are the values specified in the CREF= option. For a two-sided design, the power and expected sample sizes under hypotheses θ=ci*thetha1l and θ=ci*thetha1u are displayed, where thetha1l and thetha1u are the lower and upper alternative references, respectively. The default is CREF=0 to 1.5 by 0.01.

arguments.name: ERRSPEND
arguments.description: Displays a plot of the error spending for all sequential boundaries in the designs simultaneously. You can display the information level (HSCALE=INFO) or the stage number (HSCALE=STAGE) on the horizontal axis. With HSCALE=INFO, the information in percentage of its corresponding fixed-sample design is used in the plot. The default is HSCALE=STAGE.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: Suppresses all plots.

arguments.name: POWER
arguments.description: Displays a plot of the power curves under various hypothetical references. For a one-sided design, the power and expected sample sizes under hypotheses θ=ci*thetha1 are displayed, where θ1 is the alternative reference and ci are the values specified in the CREF= option. For a two-sided design, the power and expected sample sizes under hypotheses θ=ci*thetha1l and θ=ci*thetha1u are displayed, where thetha1l and thetha1u are the lower and upper alternative references, respectively. The default is CREF=0 to 1.5 by 0.01.

arguments.name: RCI
arguments.description: Displays a plot of repeated confidence intervals. Repeated confidence intervals include both rejection and acceptance confidence intervals.

arguments.name: TEST
arguments.description: [Syntax: TEST<(HSCALE=INFO | SAMPLESIZE)>] Displays a plot of the sequential boundaries and test variables. Either the information level (HSCALE=INFO) or the sample size (HSCALE=SAMPLESIZE) is displayed on the horizontal axis.

arguments.name: PREDPOWER
arguments.description: Displays predictive powers given the most recently observed statistic.

arguments.name: PSS
arguments.description: Displays powers and expected sample sizes under various hypothetical references. The default is CREF= 0 0.5 1.0 1.5.

arguments.name: RCI
arguments.description: Displays repeated confidence intervals for the parameter from the observed statistic at each stage.

arguments.name: STOPPROB
arguments.description: Displays expected cumulative stopping probabilities under various hypothetical references. The default is CREF= 0 0.5 1.0 1.5.
